overview_of_class: In this course, students will complete the post-production phase of their thesis projects, which includes finishing steps such as sound mix and color correction. Students will present their completed films or interactive media projects in a public screening that they will organize and publicize. The course will also serve as an introduction to the business side of documentary production, including fundraising for film projects, sustainable business practices and structure, fiscal sponsorships, navigating festivals, broadcast and distribution, DIY exhibition, and audience engagement.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course, students will complete the post-production phase of their thesis projects, which includes finishing steps such as sound mix and color correction. Students will present their completed films or interactive media projects in a public screening that they will organize and publicize. The course will also serve as an introduction to the business side of documentary production, including fundraising for film projects, sustainable business practices and structure, fiscal sponsorships, navigating festivals, broadcast and distribution, DIY exhibition, and audience engagement.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will acquire the necessary skills to take a film project through a series of complex finishing steps all the way to distribution and exhibition.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, research, in class presentations, assignments, and completed 12-20 minute documentary film or equivalent in interactive format.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Students are expected to own a portable hard drive for editing and budget their production grant award to cover any external costs for e.g. sound mix, graphics, and color correction. Textbook or course pack TBD, but not to exceed $50.
